description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Bologna" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Bologna

places.generalDescription: Giardini Margherita is Bologna's largest and most popular park, attracting locals and tourists alike. As the sun sets, it becomes a favorite spot to unwind and enjoy the transformation of the sky. The park features a jogging path, play areas for kids, a lake, and plenty of trees and lawns. It offers a serene atmosphere for visitors to relax with blankets, wine, and nibbles while soaking up the warm evening ambiance.

sources.snippet: Giardini Margherita is the biggest park in Bologna, as well as the most popular one. It's outside of the city and it's the perfect place if you want to spend some time far from the chaos. There is also a small pond, which gives a romantic atmosphere to the place.
sources.shortName: Some ideas for Valentine's day in Bologna

sources.snippet: If you prefer green areas, don't miss a stop at Giardini Margherita, a peaceful English-inspired park where you can spend special moments amidst its avenues, lawns and waterways.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Bologna 2024

places.name: Giardini Margherita

reviews.text:
A great park for a family outing. It has multiple playgrounds, a carousel, and a place to eat and drink next to the pond with plentiful fish and turtles that can be seen from the seats. Plenty of shade on the hot days. We spent several hours here with our toddler and enjoyed every minute of it!
Special shout out to the person in charge of the carousel: his friendly demeanor and mannerisms got our son to absolutely love him! Handing him the ride tokens was one of the happiest moments of the day for our boy.

Beautiful green space easily accessible from the center of Bologna.  Some playgrounds, remote working space, walkways great for kids to ride bicycles on and some playgrounds. There are a few cafe's and bars as well and a very small go kart course with electric go karts and pedal karts.  It's a gem in this city and a must visit on a nice day.

Very nice park to go on a romantic stroll with your partner, have a picnic, and take pictures. I wish the trees gave more shade from the sun… it was very sunny. Parking is 2.5 euros per hour. No free parking.

places.address: Viale Giovanni Gozzadini, 40136 Bologna BO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Santuario Madonna di San Luca is a stunning hilltop Roman Catholic sanctuary church in Bologna, Italy. The baroque-style church is dedicated to the Virgin Mary and features a beautiful cupola. Visitors can embark on a scenic CAI trail that starts in Bologna and follows the arcades of San Luca, offering breathtaking views as it passes through Casalecchio and ends in Sasso Marconi at the Ponte di Vizzano.

sources.snippet: This oft-overlooked town in the Po Valley has all the cultural credentials of its historic counterparts, with world-class operas, scenic views from the Sanctuary of the Madonna di San Luca, and a marvelous basilica. But there’s an edge to Bologna that might surprise visitors who only stick to the cobbled alleys around Piazza Maggiore. It’s a major university city.
sources.shortName: Things to do at night in Bologna to experience the city like a local

sources.snippet: This tour offers a unique perspective on the city, as the Sanctuary of San Luca is elevated 300 meters above the rest of Bologna.
sources.shortName: 14 Romantic Things to do in Bologna for Couples

places.name: Santuario Madonna di San Luca

reviews.text: The Santuario della Madonna di San Luca, located on a hill overlooking Bologna, was for me the most impressive sanctuary in the area. Reaching it via the seemingly endless staircase under the iconic portico is an experience in itself. Both the interior and exterior are striking, and the panoramic view from the top is great. For the athletic visitor, it makes an ideal destination for a challenging run or a scenic stop during a road biking session. Truly a must-visit landmark.

The road until there on foot is  pretty exhausted but that won't really matter when you arrive there. The views over the city are breathtaking, the sanctuary is well preserved, the entry is free and the garden is very beautiful and well maintained. In case you need there is a place where you can top up your water bottle, you will need it until there . The road until there is underneath some columns and the entire road is safe from rain or sun. There is also a paid bus that can take you there, from a private company. Up there there is only one restaurant which is good.

Though I didn't get in as it was already late to get in nor ask for information. The route walking there is mostly for sportive people. The stairs, steep hill walking there made me regret going there but was the most rewarding experience ever seeing the church. A lot if money is needed to maintain it as already peeling off.

places.address: Via di San Luca, 36, 40135 Bologna BO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Basilica di San Petronio is a grand Gothic basilica in Bologna, dedicated to the city's patron saint, Petronius. The 14th-century edifice boasts an unfinished brick and marble facade and houses 22 art-filled side chapels. It stands as one of Italy's most monumental Gothic basilicas, with a capacity for up to 28,000 people.

sources.snippet: This architectural marvel is absolutely stunning at sunset, and its location on the Piazza Maggiore makes it the perfect stop on the way to or from dinner. You can linger in the dimming light admiring the facade of this UNESCO World Heritage Site and its fabulous Fountain of Neptune.
sources.shortName: Things to do at night in Bologna to experience the city like a local

sources.snippet: You can explore the historic center, visit landmarks like Piazza Maggiore, the Two Towers, and the Basilica of San Petronio, and enjoy the city’s famous cuisine. If you have more time, you can dive deeper into museums or take a short trip to the surrounding areas.
sources.shortName: What to see in Bologna in 2 days: the mini-guide

sources.snippet: The main plaza of Bologna is Piazza Maggiore and there is a lot to see here including the Basilica of San Petronio. This church was meant to be the largest church in the world, but when the Vatican caught wind of the construction, they put a halt to that.
sources.siteName: The Planet D: Adventure Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 26 Best Things to do in Bologna, Italy - Plus Day Trips

sources.snippet: While walking under the porticoes, you will be able to visit the artisan shops in the center. You can reach the two towers, and go on Torre degli Asinelli, where you can enjoy a view of Bologna from above.
sources.shortName: Some ideas for Valentine's day in Bologna

places.name: Basilica di San Petronio

reviews.text: Large historical church with a great collection of religious art. There is also a meridian line, that uses the sun to tell you what day and month it is. It was pretty accurate and very fascinating how centuries ago they were able to set this up.

The Basilica di San Petronio is more than just a church, it's one of the most awe-inspiring spaces in Bologna, blending massive scale, scientific ingenuity, and quiet grandeur. It's the sixth-largest church in Europe, and standing beneath its soaring vaults, you feel every bit of that scale. What made our visit truly special was witnessing the sunbeam cross the enormous meridian line, a sundial built into the floor that still tracks solar noon with remarkable precision. It was a quiet moment, but deeply powerful; like watching time and faith align in a single ray of light.

What many don't realize is that this basilica was originally intended to be even larger than St. Peter's in Rome, until the Vatican halted its expansion. That ambition still lingers in the unfinished façade and colossal proportions. Every chapel feels like its own world, and the blend of Gothic structure with Renaissance detail invites you to linger.

San Petronio isn't just a church; it's a testament to Bologna's boldness, intellect, and soul. If you're lucky enough to catch the sundial in action, it's a moment that stays with you.

A massive cathedral in the very centre of Bologna that's definitely not to be missed.
There is so much to see inside and try and take in that more than one visit may be required. It's also a great place for a seat and rest especially when it's so hot outside.

places.generalDescription: Parco della Chiusa, also known as Parco Talon, is a sprawling green space in Bologna with the ruins of a villa and scenic trails for hiking and biking. The park's aristocratic design reflects traces of French and Italian garden architecture, offering picturesque overlooks. Visitors can embark on a flat 40-minute cycling trip from the city center to reach the park, passing by Certosa Cemetery and historic canals controlled by la Chiusa of Casalecchio.

sources.snippet: Another luxuriant attraction is the Parco della Chiusa in Casalecchio di Reno, featuring a wide variety of landscapes and paths that wind along the hillsides and through the woods next to the Reno River. From the park you can also admire a suggestive sunset over the ancient Sluice of Casalecchio.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Bologna 2024

places.name: Parco della Chiusa

reviews.text: Otherwise known as Parco Talon by locals (the name of the ruined Villa at the beginning), you might call this Bologna's “Central Park”. A bit ambitious, for sure, but this is a wonderful park with miles of cycle paths, walking paths, woods, large meadows for picnics, informal games, sunbathing... you get the picture. It has a bit of a bohemian feel to it: not unkempt, but just relaxed, natural and a without pretentiousness. It is the gateway to the walk to the Basilica of San Luca (you start at the church of San Martino), a walk of around 1,5 miles (2kms), about 400m of hill climb, so you need good shoes and about 45 mins. And it is also the gateway to mountain biking alongside the Reno River, and will take you all the way up the valley - fantastic biking. The first part of that track, by the way, is what is known as the “Cammino degli Dei”: the historic Roman trade route, which connects Bologna to Florence. Anyway, if you are staying in Bologna for a few weeks, this Park is a must.
Lovely place to rest, look at the chestnut trees and enjoy the peace ad quiet. Others were walking their dogs or doing yoga.
Recommend e-biking through the park with Slow e-motion Bologna! Call Stella today!

places.address: Via Panoramica, 40033 Casalecchio di Reno BO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Bologna's medieval center, Vicolo Colombina is a charming restaurant located at the end of a quiet alleyway. While it may seem like a typical traditional eatery at first glance, its menu offers a modern twist on classic Bolognese dishes. The homemade tagliatelle, served in a unique pyramid shape with rich sauce, is a standout dish.

sources.snippet: It'd be a mistake to miss the most hidden restaurant of Bologna, that's just under your nose. Vicolo Colombina is only a few steps from Piazza Maggiore, in a tiny street with a view on San Petronio Basilica.
sources.shortName: 8 Romantic restaurants to fall in love in Bologna

places.name: Vicolo Colombina

reviews.text: A beautifully furnished spot with cozy atmosphere serving classic Italian dishes. We enjoyed all of the classics, tortellini in brodo, lasagna, and ragù, all of which were perfectly seasoned and cooked. The primi piatti (appetisers) were also very delicious, however my favourite was definitely the caramel dessert we had. It was soft and tender yet not overly sweet. I'd highly recommend this place if you're looking to try classic Italian dishes, just be sure to book in advance because they are usually very busy!

An excellent restaurant with delicious food and very friendly and helpful staff. The ambiance is perfect.
The baked onion and the ragu were outstanding, as was all the other food we had! Finished off the meal with a salted caramel digestive which was the highlight of the meal!
We are looking froward to coming back next year when we return to Bologna.
You need to book in advance.

We reserved early and were pleased to dine here. The food was excellent. We shared the mortadella and potato soufflé and the tortellini with Parmesan cream sauce. Both delicious. My wife had the eggplant Parmesan, a lighter, grilled version of the classic and I had the cutlet with prosciutto and cheese. Lovely service and delicious food. Make reservations. We saw them turn away many, even in September.

places.generalDescription: Neptune's Fountain, also known as the Fountain of Neptune (Fontana del Nettuno), is a stunning 16th-century fountain located in Bologna. This magnificent work of art was created by Giambologna and commissioned to glorify the papal government of Pope Pius IV. The fountain stands in the center of Piazza del Nettuno and features a bronze statue of Neptune atop a pedestal, surrounded by spurting mermaids and four heraldic dolphins representing rivers from different continents.

sources.snippet: Located next to Piazza Maggiore is Piazza del Nettuno that centres around the sculpture of Neptune’s Fountain. The fountain is an imposing sight with the God Neptune standing atop a three-tiered fountain consisting of Nereids and Cherubs. Construction dates back to 1567.
sources.siteName: The Planet D: Adventure Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 26 Best Things to do in Bologna, Italy - Plus Day Trips

places.name: Neptune's Fountain

reviews.text: Master sculptor Giambologna created this great piece for everyone to view at Piazza del Netunno. From a specific angle you can see Neptune's thumb align with his groin to give an illusion of his manhood .

Great location.
Wish I had more time here. Lots of shops and restaurants. During my evening there noticed alot of construction in the area. I assume it's all part of progress. I would definitely recommend this location for dining and shopping. During my visit there was a huge outdoor theater set up for public entertainment.
This fountain is truly a work of art! Perfect place to sit, take in and observe it's beauty. There is a certain calm that washes over one's body while near this fountain.

places.address: Piazza del Nettuno, 40124 Bologna BO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Nestled away from the bustling heart of Bologna, Sette Tavoli offers a delightful escape into a world of culinary creativity. With its name reflecting the intimate setting of just seven tables, this charming eatery exudes warmth and friendliness reminiscent of a cozy home. Guests can indulge in an enticing selection of Italian dishes that feature innovative twists, all served within a snug atmosphere adorned with an impressive wine cellar.

sources.snippet: InfoOsteria BottegaVia Santa Caterina, 51, 40123 BolognaTel: +39 051 585111Price for two: 100 € Sette tavoli         Out of the loud city center, under the winding porticoed of Via Cartolerie that comes out directly from the middle ages, you find Sette Tavoli.​As the name says, there are only 7 tables, for a very intimate location. Sometimes, raising your head out of your spaghetti with shrimps, you could feel like you’re in a cozy and friendly home, with a great wine cellar. InfoSette TavoliVia Cartoleria, 15/2, 40124 BolognaTel: +39 051 272900www.settetavoli.itPrice for two: 70 €                       Aperitivo in Bologna: my complete guide Happy students, curious tourists, tired workers: everybody wants to have aperitivo.​But what is exactly aperitivo?.
sources.shortName: 7 romantic restaurants to fall in love in Bologna

sources.snippet: Out of the loud city centre, under the winding porticoed of Via Cartolerie that comes out directly from the middle ages, you find Sette Tavoli.​As the name says, there are only 7 tables, for a very intimate location. Sometimes, raising your head out of your spaghetti with shrimps, you could feel like you’re in a cosy and friendly home, with a great wine cellar. Info Sette TavoliVia Cartoleria, 15/2, 40124 BolognaTel: +39 051 272900www.settetavoli.itPrice for two: 70 €
sources.shortName: 8 Romantic restaurants to fall in love in Bologna

places.name: Sette Tavoli

reviews.text: I was especially blown away by the tiramisu, absolutely wonderful. The owner was so friendly and welcoming and every dish was delicious. Our favourite was the tortellini in a cream sauce.

If you're looking for a trattoria style place this is definitely the one! The atmosphere was perfect from the first step into the vicinity, the dining room was decorated with traditional wooden cabinets and walls adorned with vintage posters, it felt like having lunch at grandma's. Apart from that, the food was also very good, super comforting and rich & flavourful at the same time. I'd highly recommend visiting, can't wait to be back! (I'd suggest booking in advanced because there are only 7 tables, as per the name)

We had a wonderful dining experience here. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was warm and inviting.
The staff were friendly and attentive, which made us feel very welcome. We would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great place to enjoy a delicious meal!

places.generalDescription: All'Osteria Bottega is a cozy and laid-back restaurant that specializes in serving traditional Bolognese-style pasta and meat dishes accompanied by local wines. The establishment is known for its authentic ragu bolognese, which sparks debates among locals about its true ingredients. While some versions include pork and beef, the use of tomatoes remains a point of contention due to historical reasons.

sources.snippet: Osteria Bottega         Legend says that the first tortellino was shaped on the vision of Venus, the goddess of love.That should be why, when you have a bowl of tortellini together, it’s impossible not to fall in love. Don’t go too far though, you could have troubles recognizing who you love the most between the food and the person in front of you. Osteria Bottega is a small and old-fashioned restaurant known to serve one of the best tortellini in Bologna.
sources.shortName: 7 romantic restaurants to fall in love in Bologna

sources.snippet: Legend says that the first tortellino was shaped on the vision of Venus, the goddess of love.That should be why, when you have a bowl of tortellini together, it’s impossible not to fall in love. Don’t go too far though, you could have trouble recognizing who you love the most between the food and the person in front of you.
sources.shortName: 8 Romantic restaurants to fall in love in Bologna

places.name: All'Osteria Bottega

reviews.text: What an experience, classic bolognese cuisine with a service that was just perfect. Having arrived for lunch we'd hat to first sit outside a bit but within 15 minutes we got a spot. The essence of slow food is being presented by the kitchen & the servers. A wine collection that has been closely prepared made it even better. An amazing atmosphere for a saterday lunch, sitting inbetween friends & families. You can feel the culture & love of food.

If I could give a 10 for the service I would! Everyone was so lovely- But the tall gentleman who seemed to be a head waiter, was incredibly lovely and welcoming, we didn't have a booking for lunch but allowed us to wait for 20 minutes to find us a table, in that time we sat outside and enjoyed a lovely sparking wine that he recommended and a snack. When we got our table we sat down, waiters offered to take our coats and bags. We wanted everything from the menu, so enlisted our great waiter to recommend something for us- he did not disappoint! You MUST get the lardo to start. The pasta with artichoke and cured meat was probably the best plate of food I've ever eaten. The first day we had the poached pear - simple and divine. The second day we had the milk pudding - incredible and annoyed that I didn't pack some in my suitcase home. We both left here feeling like we were being hugged by our stomachs! We proceeded to book a table for lunch the next day.
I've eaten at around 8/9 of the well known restaurants in Bologna - this was the top. I did also say to my partner that it may be my new favourite restaurant and that I may have cheated on him with my pasta. I will be back!!!! @michelin - Bib Gourmand at least?

What can I say?

Our lovely AirBnB hosts recommended All'Osteria Bottega for my birthday and booked us a table.

The food was stunning (including rabbit terrine and baby pigeon cooked 'three ways') and the location just perfect.

I am torn between making it even more popular and wanting other people to experience their beautiful food and delightful service.

The menu changes with what is available so just make a booking and enjoy...

places.address: Via Santa Caterina, 51, 40123 Bologna BO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Osteria del Sole is a historic 15th-century wine bar located in the heart of the Quadrilatero food market in Bologna. Despite its shabby appearance, this landmark venue offers an authentic and incredible atmosphere. While they don't serve food or non-alcoholic drinks, customers are encouraged to bring their own meals from nearby establishments such as Paolo Atti bakery and Simoni deli.

sources.snippet: Osteria del Sole might be the only place in Italy to adopt the ‘BYOF’ concept where you provide the bites and they provide the booze. It’s situated in a historic inn and has plenty of nooks and crannies to cozy up in.
sources.shortName: Things to do at night in Bologna to experience the city like a local

places.name: Osteria del Sole

reviews.text:
This is a must stop in Bologna! My husband, I came here during a week-long visit. We truly stumbled across this place while looking for somewhere to grab a glass of wine. Since we saw only locals inside, we opted to go in and I'm so glad we did. We found out later that this is the second oldest Osteria in Italy!

The photos on the wall depict some of its amazing patrons who have been here in the past. We both got to try to very different types of amazing wine, local to the region. We decided to bring food with us from the Butcher just a few stalls down. And I'm so glad we did. The local meat and cheese paired well with the wine that we had, and offered a great respite from the afternoon heat.

There is a bathroom, you don't have to pay to use, if you are staying and enjoying a drink. There is plenty of seats and tables inside. And there are a few spots outside for smokers as well.

The two gentlemen behind the bar were more than accommodating, and offered us a great deal of options to choose from for our wine. I was deciding between two that was suggested, and I was able to get a sample of each to try. The gentleman made sure I finish my entire sample before he poured me a fresh glass, fuller than I anticipated.

The prices were more than fair and with this laid-back atmosphere, I felt I could stay there for hours, enjoying wine and a meal. This place is also good for groups, as they have a good amount of space to accommodate.

You don't have to dress up, or feel uncomfortable in wearing something more casual here. It's not a very fussy place, which is why I think it should be on everyone's list to visit. No reservations needed, you just walk in and find a spot.

When my husband and I returned to Bologna, you can be sure I will be coming back!

Great vibe of authentic vintage pub. Really nice staff. Got two tasty local cheap beers and ate own lunch. A little disappointment was that the beer is bottled.  It is not the place where you would like to spend whole evening, but i would recommend it for a quick drink.

I honestly can't even put into words how much I love this place. The drinks are always on point! The selection of snacks is insanely good, with so many tasty options that perfectly complement the drinks. What really stood out to me was how friendly and polite the waitstaff were. They spoke English well, which made ordering easy and stress-free, especially for a tourist like me.

places.generalDescription: Pizzeria Due Torri is a bustling counter-serve spot offering traditional pizza by the slice or whole, along with calzones and sandwiches. It's located in Bologna, where the iconic Two Towers, Asinelli and Garisenda, stand tall as symbols of the city's medieval past. These towers were built in the 12th century by noble families to showcase their wealth and influence. Visitors can climb the Asinelli Tower for a breathtaking panoramic view of Bologna.

sources.shortName: 14 Romantic Things to do in Bologna for Couples

places.name: Pizzeria Due Torri

reviews.text: Don't expect anything fancy, but expect to pay for what you eat: 4,60€ for 2 BIG freshly made slices of pizza. Good to stop on the go!
One of the best pizza we eated. The crust is perfect: thin and crispy and the tomato sauce îs și flavorful. We've been last year here and we've return especially for this one 🩷
Some of the best pizza I've ever eaten and it only cost €2 euros a slice! I shall be returning for breakfast tomorrow.

sources.shortName: 14 Romantic Things to do in Bologna for Couples

sources.siteName: The Planet D: Adventure Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 26 Best Things to do in Bologna, Italy - Plus Day Trips

reviews.text: I'm happy to give this 5 stars as Gabriele our guide was superb. He was very knowledgeable and passionate about the food. All the food we tried was of the highest quality. However, I do feel that the tour is rather expensive for what you get in terms of quantity. Do not skip breakfast as other reviews have suggested. We expected to have a coffee at the beginning of the tour. As nice as they were, the pasta sample dishes were very small and left us wanting more food. Ice cream at the end was delicious. Gabriele was very kind in providing us with further recommendations for our time in Bologna and elsewhere in Italy.

A first experience with Secret Food Tours and definitely not the last! Bologna is home to so many local delicacies, going on a food tour is easiest to taste your way through the city, make some friends, and get superb recommendations for the remainder of your time.

Gabriele (our guide) is a true foodie and you can feel his passion for Bologna as a city, and Italy in general through the way he speaks of their food culture. He presented us with a little treat before starting the food tour 😋 We were brought to a local pasta laboratory to observe fresh pasta being made right infront of us! There was also balsamic vinegar tasting (amazing) at a local wine cellar, a meats-and-cheese platter, a sumptuous lunch (2 types of fresh pasta with butter/sage, and a ragu sauce), wines, a superb gelato, and a surprise treat to end the tour. Overall a wonderful experience (even in the heat of Italian summer).

Yesterday we enjoyed an amazing tour of Bologna with Mattia. So knowledgeable! Arrive hungry, there's so much to try. As a group of 12 it's a good number to have others to talk to & get to know each other a bit. Highly recommend - the best tour we have done

places.generalDescription: Ristorante I Portici is located in the heart of Bologna, within a luxurious hotel that seamlessly blends Art Nouveau charm with modern design. The restaurant occupies the nineteenth-century hall of the former Eden Theater, boasting a stunning frescoed ceiling and exquisite Art Nouveau artwork. Renowned chef Agostino Iacobucci presents a unique culinary experience, fusing northern and southern Italian influences with exotic flavors.

sources.snippet: InfoRistorante I CarracciVia Manzoni, 2, 40121 BolognaTel: +39 051 225445www.grandhotelmajestic.duetorrihotels.comPrice for 2: from 160 € I Portici         The only Michelin-starred restaurant in Bologna center is set in the only one café chantant remaining in town. At the rising of the 19th century, people went there to listen to piano music, drinking Champagne from a crystal cup. Now the young chef Emanuele Petrosino welcomes you with his rich and complex cuisine.His spaghetti with 5 tomatoes is better than a pearl necklace.
sources.shortName: 7 romantic restaurants to fall in love in Bologna

sources.snippet: The only Michelin-starred restaurant in Bologna center is set in the only café chantant remaining in town. At the rise of the 19th century, people went there to listen to piano music and drink Champagne from a crystal cup. Now the young chef Emanuele Petrosino welcomes you with his rich and complex cuisine.
sources.shortName: 8 Romantic restaurants to fall in love in Bologna

places.name: Ristorante I Portici

reviews.text: We didn't stay at the hotel, just came for the food - and it was a wonderful experience! A couple of the dishes were unusual for us, yet surprisingly delicious. The service was elegant and perfectly timed, making the whole evening absolutely worth it. My only recommendation would be to make the pasta dishes smaller, because they made the experience quite filling

A Huge Disappointment – Not Up to Michelin Standards

We visited this restaurant with high expectations and were excited for a 7-course menu with wine pairings. Unfortunately, it turned out to be one of the most disappointing Michelin experiences we've ever had. While the dishes were beautifully presented, the flavor combinations were outright unsuccessful. The entire menu was marked by an overwhelming use of smoky elements, which dominated and became monotonous across almost every dish.

Out of the seven courses, there was only one we actually finished. We left the rest uneaten, despite the small portions-not because we were full, but because the food simply wasn't enjoyable. The most memorable parts of the meal were the snacks served beforehand: a puffed chip and a lemon sorbet, which were well-balanced and tasty. But it says a lot when the snacks are the highlight of a Michelin menu.

The wine pairing was also disappointing. One of the "wines" turned out to be a beer, which-while creative in concept-was a complete misstep. The beer had an intense smell of cow urine (not just the barnyard notes one might encounter in some natural wines). The waiter laughed and acknowledged that the beer had a peculiar flavor, which seemed to be part of the intended experience or a gimmick. Unfortunately, this did nothing to improve the situation, and we were left with an unusually unpleasant taste experience without being offered an alternative.

We expected a world-class meal but left the restaurant feeling both disappointed and frustrated. If this is the standard they are presenting, it's hard to see how they can retain their Michelin star.

I had the best experience of food, service and atmosphere at this local . The best dishe I have ever had was Risone. Absolutely amazing. The main course (beef) was really unique. The creativity was super high. I had experienced a lot of new flavors.
Last but not least thanks to waiters and managers for their perfect service and this special experience.

places.generalDescription: Villa Griffone is a museum located at the site where Guglielmo Marconi conducted his pioneering experiments in remote communication. The museum showcases the equipment he invented and used for his experiments, offering insight into the history of radio, musical instruments, cinema, songs, telephones, TV, and computers. Visitors can learn about Marconi's achievements and draw inspiration from his story.

sources.shortName: 14 Romantic Things to do in Bologna for Couples

places.name: Museo Marconi

reviews.text: Great place. Not that easy to get to (country road) or to get into (bookings only, with limited availability), but it is definitely worth it. Guides talk you through Manzoni's childhood, career as an inventor, and how his inventions evolved - some good scientific explanations and demonstrations. There are some interactive exhibits for schoolkids, as well as some old scientific exhibits to look at. This is very much recommended if you can plan it and get a booking.
If you like to geek out about technology, this st the place to go. Lots of static displays as well as interactive demonstrations. The museum guide was knowledgeable and spoke English very well.

The entrance to the museum is not easy to find, and there are no instructions at all. Overall, the place is nice to visit as a tribute to Guglielmo Marconi - one of the greatest inventors of all time.

places.address: Via Celestini, 1, 40037 Sasso Marconi BO, Italy

places.generalDescription: I Carracci is a renowned Italian restaurant located in the heart of Bologna, inside an elegant 18th-century building that also houses a hotel. The restaurant is famous for its exquisite frescoes from the Carracci school, adorning the ceiling of its charming and refined dining room. The menu at I Carracci offers a blend of classic and modern Italian dishes, showcasing regional traditions as well as seafood and land-based cuisine.

sources.snippet: I Carracci         Named after the most important baroque painters of Bologna, this elegant restaurant inside Grand Majestic Hotel is a place for special occasions. Frescoed ceilings, long shiny tablecloths and a nouvelle-cuisine touch can be the ingredients of one of the most romantic dinners of your life. But don’t panic, you will find traditional dishes such as tagliatelle or passatelli, as well.​After all, true love should make you feel at home.
sources.shortName: 7 romantic restaurants to fall in love in Bologna

sources.snippet: Named after the most important baroque painters of Bologna, this elegant restaurant inside the Grand Majestic Hotel is a place for special occasions. Frescoed ceilings, long shiny tablecloths and a nouvelle-cuisine touch can be the ingredients of one of the most romantic dinners of your life. But don’t panic, you will find traditional dishes such as tagliatelle or passatelli, as well.​After all, true love should make you feel at home.
sources.shortName: 8 Romantic restaurants to fall in love in Bologna

places.name: I Carracci

reviews.text: Exceptional experience through and through. The atmosphere sets the tone with the beautiful ceilings by the Carracci brothers. The service was exceptional, on point, knowledgeable, with excellent pace. Andrea and Gianluca took excellent care of us. The food courses were an exceptional variety of choices with a more contemporary and qualitative approach yet keeping true to the world renowned Bolognese cuisine. It was the birthday of my wife and I appreciated all the wonderful attention and care. So,so happy we are only 1 hour 10 minutes away!
The tasting menu was the best meal I've ever had. Everything was perfectly prepared. The dishes were unique and delicious. The wine suggestions were spot on.
Fantastic food and service! I recommend trying the traditional tasting menu.

places.generalDescription: If you're planning a trip to Bologna, the Golden Hyundai Car Dealership is an excellent choice for your automotive needs. Conveniently located near major highways like the A1, it offers easy access for those driving into the city. Whether you’re renting a car from Bologna Guglielmo Marconi Airport or bringing your own vehicle, you'll find ample public parking available. Customers have praised their experiences at Golden Hyundai, noting efficient service and reliable communication with staff members like Mr.

sources.snippet: If you prefer to drive, Bologna is easily accessible from several major highways, including the A1, which runs from Milan to Bologna and on to Rome. You can rent a car from major providers at Bologna Guglielmo Marconi Airport, or you can drive your own car and park in one of the city's public parking lots.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A 3 day romantic trip to Bologna, Italy

places.name: Golden Hyundai Car Dealership

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Very satisfied with the purchase of my new car. I invite everyone to visit the Ravenna dealership at least once. Gabriele is a very affable and competent person.

(Original)
Molto soddisfatto dell'acquisto della mia nuova auto.Invito tutti a visitare la  concessionaria di Ravenna almeno una volta. Gabriele è una persona molto affabile e competente.

The attitude and responsibility of the personnel from the workshop, towards the clients, in my oppinion, is equal to zero. I would even say that they don't care about anything. I made an appointment for the replacement of the summer tires with the winter tires and I specified from the beginning that I want to store the summer tires (for a fee). When I got the car from the shop, after changing the tires, I had the unpleasant surprise to find the summer tires in the car, two of them (dirty) being placed directly in the trunk, without being wrapped  in a protective foil and making a mess around.
They told me they didn't have more room in the warehouse, even though I have had a reservation made one week prior, with the option of storing the summer tires…
However, they choose to replace the tires without notifying me by phone before, that they no longer have room  the summer tires, thus not giving me the option to choose another workshop for the exchange, where I could have left the summer tires. As a result, I had to pay double and loose 3 hours to find a solution for taking the summer tires to a place for storage. I regret that I made this choice and I do not recommend this service to anyone.

(Translated by Google) It closes at 7pm. You walk down the street, you're there at 6pm and everything is closed? Not a good move, the internet needs to be updated.

(Original)
Chiude alle 19.00 fai della strada, alle 18 sei la ed è tutto chiuso ? Non una bella mossa, internet va aggiornato.

places.address: Via de' Carracci, 6, 40131 Bologna BO, Italy

sources.snippet: Let's make it short: one of the best traditional restaurants in Bologna in one of the best locations in Bologna. Trattoria Da Me opens in 2024 a second spot in town inside Torre dei Galluzzi, one of the 20 towers in Bologna still up. Can you think of a more romantic location?
sources.shortName: 8 Romantic restaurants to fall in love in Bologna

places.name: Trattoria Da Me Nella Torre

reviews.text: Typical Bologna specialities in a beautiful historic setting. The ancient tower, renovated in careful detail, is a delightful location for enjoying the wonderful cuisine. We loved the antipasto of local hams and the ice cream soft cheeses were a modern twist on Italian classics. The pasta dishes were all excellent, big portions of lasagne, tagliatelle and tortellini, all made faithfully to the traditional recipes. The cotoletta is a big portion, so come with an appetite if you order this . Staff were friendly and fun, it has a light hearted and young spirit. A bustling trattoria that is worth coming back to. Buon appetito!

Recommended by a local. The trattoria is tucked within a small courtyard, built inside what I can only describe as a watch tower, which is a beautiful setting. A blend of old and new. We did make a reservation, and were seated quickly. Something I never would have ordered would be “cheese ice cream” with additional fried bread puffs (servers recommendation) but I tell you what it was quite delicious. We opted for a glass of the house white, crisp and refreshing. Mains were the classic ragu and the crumbed veal. The pasta was delicate and the veal was so tender. Would recommend to a friend.

Makes me smile when I think of this place. It is like I am returning there and have the tastes in my mouth.
Me and my husband had a great dinner night with lovely atmosphere in Bologna. The service was slow , since the restaurant was full and there was only one server at the outside area. The food was amazing though and everything else was just magical. We had one great red wine which I still remember how it tasted! Our visit was almost a year ago and I hope we can visit again together.

places.address: Corte de Galluzzi, 5/A, 40123 Bologna BO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Casa Monica is a small restaurant located in Via San Rocco, known for its exceptional fish-based menu. The attention to detail is evident in every aspect, from the carefully chosen colors adorning the walls to the vibrant hues present in each dish. The restaurant takes pride in using fresh ingredients, with a dedicated farmer delivering milk and cream twice a week and sourcing pistachio paste from a trusted supplier. Guests can expect an unforgettable dining experience characterized by exquisite flavors and refined dishes.

sources.snippet: InfoRistorante MarconiVia Porrettana 291, 40037 Sasso Marconi, BolognaTel: +39 051 846216www.ristorantemarconi.itPrice for 2: 160 € Casa Monica         “Painting is easy and funny like cooking” said Monica’s father, a famous painter.And you can tell it by the quality of food and location of this small restaurant in Via San Rocco. Every detail is perfectly studied, from the colors on the walls to the colors in your dish. ​Casa Monica serves one of the best fish-based menu in Bologna, surely the most loved.
sources.shortName: 7 romantic restaurants to fall in love in Bologna

places.name: Ristorante Casa Monica

reviews.text: What a beautiful meal. Food is exceptional and creative. Every dish memorable. Cuttlefish risotto exceptional. Wonderful in house baked focaccio. Lovely atmosphere in the restaurant, we loved the decor. House wine super. Service spot on.

Wonderful restaurant with great service. Daniele personally came to check on our evening. The food was tasty - with the daily menu offering seasonal delights.

The ambience is lovely - it's not a place to go if you want a quite dinner as all diners sit in one large, stylishly finished room. Will definitely return

I typically don't like leaving negative reviews, but unfortunately, my experience at this restaurant was very disappointing. The food just didn't measure up to our expectations. Out of four different dishes that we ordered, we only enjoyed one.

To make matters worse, the soup that I ordered with clams was filled with sand, which really detracted from the dish. And to top it all off, the prices were quite high, making the whole experience feel like a waste of money.

After having some of the best meals of our vacation in Tuscany, it was really disappointing to end things on such a sour note. Overall, I cannot recommend this restaurant based on my experience.

places.address: Via S. Rocco, 16a, 40122 Bologna BO, Italy
